radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver has a homogeneous echotexture, no evidence of steatosis, no parenchymal abnormality along the gallbladder fossa, no focal liver lesion, main portal vein is patent with appropriate hepatopetal flow, mild intrahepatic biliary dilatation, gallbladder severely distended to 5 x 10 cm filled with echogenic sludge and debris, no definite gallbladder wall thickening, edema or pericholecystic fluid, equivocal sonographic Murphy's sign, tenderness over the gallbladder and other areas including the right lower quadrant, no ascites.
